intro: Senecio cachinalensis var. copiapinus, commonly known as the Copiapó senecio, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. It is adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and desert environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
